name: Vs. Dr. Mario
summary: Vs. Dr. Mario is the Vs. System version of Dr. Mario. The game drops the Slow mode and features a less generous scoring system. In the NES version, each virus is worth twice as much as the last. In the VS. version, a virus is worth only 200 points more, and not twice as many points, as the previous virus.

name: Vs. Pinball
summary: Vs. Pinball is the multiplayer arcade version of Pinball, a game where you control the paddles of a virtual pinball machine representing a traditional pinball game.

name: Vs. Ice Climber
summary: Part of the Vs. Series, known as Vs. Ice Climber, includes gameplay features not found in the home console release, such as an animated title screen, stage select menu, 16 additional mountains, occasional blizzard and wind effects, more enemy characters, and bonus multiplier items.

name: Vs. Raid on Bungeling Bay
summary: VS. Raid on Bungeling Bay is a 1985 shoot 'em up game, developed by Hudson Soft, which is a Nintendo VS. System port of the NES version of Raid on Bungeling Bay, which in turn is a port of a 1984 Commodore 64 game developed by Will Wright.

name: Vs. Duck Hunt
summary:
Duck Hunt was released as an arcade game in the Nintendo VS. series in 1984 as Vs. Duck Hunt, and is included in the PlayChoice-10 arcade console, an arcade machine with as many as 10 different games previously available only on the NES. The console supports two light guns, allowing two players at once.

Gameplay consists of alternating rounds with 12 ducks/targets per round instead of 10 and sometimes requires the player to shoot three ducks/targets at a time instead of two. In addition, the player is given a limited number of lives; every duck/target that is not hit costs one life. When all lives are gone, the game ends.

After every second round, a bonus stage is played in which ducks can be shot for points as they fly out of the grass. However, the hunting dog occasionally jumps out, putting himself in the line of fire and creating a distraction. If the player shoots the dog, the bonus stage immediately ends.

name: V-Shift
summary: V-Shift is a high-intensity, fast-paced, battle platformer where mastering your movement is key to victory. Choose your champion and become the ultimate gladiator in a galaxy-wide alien arena. Master the V-Shift: velocity is damage; stillness is death.

name: Vs. Tetris
summary: Vs. Tetris is a game developed by Tengen for the Nintendo Vs. Unisystem arcade platform. The game would be the basis for Tetris (NES, Tengen) released some time later, and is noticeably less developed (e.g. the piece graphics use only solid colored or striped blocks).

name: Vs. Maxx 25-in-1
summary:
The 25-in-1 by Video Extreme features 25 games. It takes 4 AA batteries. The 25 games that are on the controller are made by JungleTac Interactive

Games Included:
- Built Up Road (unlinked)
- Bold (unlinked)
- Star Ally
- Valiant Rescue (unlinked)
- Smart Escape (unlinked)
- Zero Tiger (unlinked)
- Space Castle
- Aero Engine
- Last Cabra
- Pool Pro
- Jewel Master
- Move Fun
- Ultra Doggy
- Pinball Track
- Spin Ball (unlinked)
- Birdie Nest
- Bingo Zap
- Bump Car
- GP Race
- Speedy Way-X (unlinked)
- Road Bumper (unlinked)
- Excel Racing
- Big Racing (unlinked)
- VR Racing
- Insect Chase (unlinked)

name: VS Mahjong: Otome Ryouran
summary: A Mahjong game developed by Kaneko where you can play 1V1 Strip-Mahjong as one out of the twelve Japanese high school girls on the roster. Each one participates in a different after-school club. Win any of them on this slightly dishonest arcade to sneak a peek!

name: Vs. Super Sky Kid
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of the NES version of Sky Kid.

name: Vs. Toukaidou Gojuusan-tsugi
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System port of Toukaidou Gojuusan-tsugi .

name: Vs. Clu Clu Land
summary: Vs. Clu Clu Land is the Nintendo Vs. System (Arcade) port of Clu Clu Land (NES). In the game, two fish must swim through a maze attempting to reveal hidden gold bars while fighting against sea urchins. The game has multiplayer support for 2 simultaneous players.

name: Vsevolod
summary:
Welcome to Vsevolod, the awesome game of battle for the control of the Galaxy and the world domination!

You, Vsevolod the Knight, are destined to unite all tribes, liberate the long-suffering peoples in the farthest corners of space, and bring the peace and prosperity to the Galaxy. But first you have to destroy all your enemies. You can destroy them by taking their life energy by bumping into them, but remember, this takes your life energy, too. You can also bump them into each other or into the walls. You can also bump them into other objects, like stars, asteroids, and various pieces of garbage floating in space. Good luck with your quest and remember - the fate of the Galaxy lies with you!

name: Vs. Wrecking Crew
summary: Vs. Wrecking Crew is an arcade game for the VS. System, predating the 1985 console game Wrecking Crew. The game is less puzzle oriented, does not contain the level editor, and features a simultaneous two-player mode in which the opposing player is seen on the other side of the construction wall. In single player, Luigi acts similar to Foreman Spike and is present in all levels, while Foreman Spike is absent entirely.

name: V.Start
summary: Welcome to the MainFrame! V.START is a Retro 2D Platformer set within a Computer from 1995, A Virus has been Detected Deep within the System. Chose your Avatar : B.O.B , B.R.T or B.T.Y and Explore 4 Unique Zones, Collect Chips, Fight Bots and Hack Terminals

name: V-Speedway
summary: V-Speedway is an introductory VR arcade racing game with simple physics, essential features and full interactive controls. The game features Single Race, Time Attack with online leaderboards, and Free Ride modes.

name: Vs. Golf
summary: Vs. Golf is a golf game developed for the VS. Arcade Systems. It is an 18 hole golf game where the player chooses stroke play or match play against a human or computer player. This game was released in two editions, a Men's Golf and Ladies Golf edition featuring male and female characters.

name: Vs.
summary:
True Fighters - True Turf

In the mean streets of today there's no law, no order. Only turf and gangs dedicated to protecting it. Real people who've learned to fight 'cause they had to. Weakness is not an option. Give 'em an inch and they'll take your whole 'hood. Fighting has never been so close to home!

Loads of cool characters and familiar environments
More blows, blocks, holds, throws, combos and counters than you can handle
Unbelievably fast gameplay
Tons of kickin' alternative rock tunes

name: Vs. Super Mario Bros.
summary: Vs. Super Mario Bros. is a two-player VS. System version of Super Mario Bros. This game has higher gameplay difficulty than the original Super Mario Bros., with fewer warp zones and power-ups, and more enemies. Six new levels were created for the game, all of which were reused in Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels.

name: V’s Rage
summary: Trapped in a video game and armed with a frying pan.

name: Vs. Lionex
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System game.

name: Vs. Babel no Tou
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Babel no Tou.

name: Vs. Nintendo 500
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System game.

name: VSR: Void Space Racing
summary: If you're looking for your generic futuristic racer, look for it elsewhere - this game is not for the faint of heart! Impactful and challenging, VSR: Void Space Racing gives you the opportunity to fly through vast and diverse locations in outer space and prove yourself worthy of the first place!

name: Vs. Helifighter
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System game.

name: Vs. Football
summary: A top-down soccer game that plays somewhat like Pong.

name: Vs. Collection
summary: Vs. Collection is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Bottom Up, which was released in Japan in 1996.

name: Vs. Gong Fight
summary: Vs. Gong Fight

name: Vs. Racing
summary: Experience the thrill and excitement of full-on arcade racing.

name: VS Sonic: Dash & Spin
summary: VS Sonic: Dash & Spin mod adds new songs, characters, a remastered tutorial, a new menu, pixel art songs and art, new boyfriend and girlfriend designs and more!

name: Vs. Ninja JaJaMaru-kun
summary: A Vs. System port of Ninja JaJaMaru-kun.

name: Vs. Platoon
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Platoon.

name: Vs. Motocross
summary: A cancelled motocross game for the Nintendo Vs. System.

name: Vs. Football
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System game.

name: Vs. Head to Head Baseball
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System game.

name: Vs Block Breaker
summary: Bizarre Breakout clone.

name: Vs. Madoola no Tsubasa
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System port of The Wing of Madoola.

name: Vs. TKO Boxing
summary: The Nintendo Vs version of Data Easts Ring King. It was available as a Nintendo Vs Conversion Kit.

name: Vs. Racing 2
summary: Experience the thrill of all-out arcade racing!

name: Vs. Vulcan Venture
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Gradius II (The Famicom version).

name: VS Round 1
summary: Versus is a fighting game starring comicbook characters from Independent publishers/creators. We plan on letting the community pick the next fighters to appear in the game.

name: Vs. Gradius
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Gradius, based on the NES version.

name: Vs. Great Tennis
summary: A cancelled Nintendo Vs. System game.

name: Vs. Family Tennis
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Family Tennis.

name: Vs. Imposter Alternated
summary: Vs. Imposter Alternated is a mod for Friday Night Funkin' that is based on Among Us. The game is a fanmade variant of the Vs. Impostor mod. Each week is set in an alternate universe. Week 1 is based off if the cut character Blue was in the mod, and Week 2 is based on the Horse Wrangling mode from Among Us.

name: Vs. Castlevania
summary: You play Simon who must battle his way through the castle using his trusty whip. The object is to fight off the evil enemies on your way to find the Count, and if you're lucky, destroy him.

name: Vs. Mighty Bomb Jack
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Mighty Bomb Jack.

name: Vs. Super Chinese
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Super Chinese.

name: VS Cartoon Cat
summary: VS Cartoon Cat is a mod developed by Keneth YT And ToK. The mod is based on Trevor Henderson's monsters and creatures, including Cartoon Cat. The mod also has various fanmade versions of Cartoon Cat.

name: Vs. Valkyrie no Bouken: Toki no Kagi Densetsu
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Valkyrie no Bouken: Toki no Kagi Densetsu.

name: Vs Chat Pack
summary: Vs Chat Pack is a Twitch streamer game pack. Four games in four different genres, all focused on Twitch chat interactions. Viewers play by typing various commands in the Twitch chat, and each game allows the viewers to individually impact the streamer's game experience!

name: Vs. Freedom Force
summary: An anti-terrorist shooter where the player shoots at terrorists while freeing hostages.

name: Vs. Battle City
summary: A Vs. System port of Battle City.

name: Vs Suicide Mouse
summary: Vs Suicide Mouse is a mod by gamepro_25. It is based on the creepypasta "suicidemouse.avi".

name: Vs. Gumshoe
summary: A platform game where you use a gun to shoot various baddies including birds and cars and to make Stevenson jump.

name: Vs. From Below
summary:
Vs. From Below is the port of From Below for Nintendo VS. System arcade hardware.
It is a puzzle game set in a fantasy medieval setting.

name: Vs. Balloon Fight
summary: A kid must float higher than the enemies to pop their balloons while avoiding lighting bolts and the giant fish.

name: Vs. Mach Rider
summary: Aliens are about to take over earth and Mach Rider must stop them by riding his motorcycle through eight stages, bumping enemy cars off the road and shooting enemy cars as well.

name: Vs. Slalom
summary: Vs. Slalom is a Nintendo VS. System (Arcade) port of Slalom (NES). a skiing game developed by Rare and published by Nintendo. The game was one of Rare's earliest efforts in video games. In the game, you'll control a skier who must race down a mountain, dodging obstacles and hitting goals, within the given time. In all there are 24 courses. Your primary goal is to be on the right side of the Slalom flags, as going on the wrong side will cause you to tumble.

name: Vs. The Goonies
summary: A whimsical platform game themed after the 1985 movie "The Goonies". Guide Mikey through caverns evading mice and the Fratellis (or use bombs or a slingshot) to save your buddies who are being held captive. The game plays Cyndi Lauper's song "Good Enough".

name: Vs. Tennis
summary: Single or doubles tennis against human or computer players. Match is best of 3 sets. Game operates on both single and dual monitor cabinets.

name: Vs. Ladies Golf
summary: Vs. Ladies Golf is a port of Golf (NES) for the Nintendo Vs. System arcade.

name: Vs. Soccer
summary: Vs. Soccer is the Nintendo VS. System (Arcade) port of Soccer (NES).

name: Vs. Puyo Puyo Sun
summary: A port of the Arcade game, made exclusively for the Sega Genesis/Mega Drive Mini 2.

name: Vs. Urban Champion
summary: Vs. Urban Champion is the Nintendo VS. System (Arcade) port of Urban Champion (NES).

name: Vs. Hogan's Alley
summary: Vs. Hogan's Alley is a Nintendo VS. System (Arcade) port of Hogan's Alley (NES).

name: Vs. Star Luster
summary: A Vs. System port of Star Luster.

name: Vs. Self
summary: Tyoma leads a double life... a life of crime and deception. His carefully crafted life is thrown into shambles when he creates an unexpected bond with a gas station customer.

name: VSCS-II
summary: VSCS-II is a retro-styled narrative game about privacy and security. Using an upgraded '80s operating system, navigate an underground network to make connections, unearth conspiracies, and ultimately decide the fate of the dark web.

name: Vs. Super Xevious: Gamp no Nazo
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Super Xevious: Gamp no Nazo.

name: Vs. Volleyball
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Volleyball.

name: Vs. Top Gun
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of Top Gun.

name: Vs. The Quest of Ki
summary: Nintendo Vs. System port of The Quest of Ki.

name: Vs. Baseball
summary: Players pick from a list of teams in this Dual Vs. baseball game. Time-points are awarded per credit which are either increased with runs batted in or decreased by opponent's runs or just regular plays. The gameplay can be very frustrating because infielders may not pick up a ball at their feet since they are waiting for another player to come over and pick it up.

name: V's Rage
summary: V’s Rage is an hand drawn action-adventure game that pays homage to classic action arcade games from the ‘80es-’90es.

name: Vs. Mahjong
summary: Vs. Mahjong is the Nintendo VS. System port of Mahjong (Famicom), that was released exclusively in Japan. It is based on the Japanese version of the Chinese board game known as Mahjong, which is commonly known as Reach Mahjong. It allows up to 4-player multiplayer game.

name: Vs. Excitebike
summary: Vs. Excitebike is a multiplayer version of the motorcross racing simulation game developed by Nintendo. It was released in the arcade shortly after the original Excitebike was released for the Famicom, partially in an attempt to create a demand for the home version in the United States.
